body:
I am working on 
- Using a wake stage in place of executorService
- Replacing protobuf with avro

I'll push the updates tomorrow.

Thanks! I will merge this. I won't have the ability to test it on a Mesos cluster. But given that you tested it, we should be fine.
The `bin` folder should not be moved. Also, the `.gitignore` and similar files should not be moved either.

merged from master
bin folder and .git\* files are moved back.
Review comments have been addressed and checked in.

@dafrista Is the current codebase extensible? E.g., we may want to add expireAfterAccess (read or write).

@bgchun The `Cache` interface is certainly open-ended enough to allow expireAfterAccess. However, the current `CacheImpl` implementation won't support it. I could rename it to `ExpireAfterWriteCache` to make this clear. What do you think?

I'm testing this on my machine after deleting the maven repository.
It works, I'll merge it

Agreed. Integration, update to cpp folder and bridge code should go with separate PR. 
The only binary in the PR is NuGet.exe I think. azure-sdk-for-net in apache uses the same way and also checked in that code. We can try if we can build without it.

With Nuget.exe, all the packages will be automatically pulled out during the build. Therefore we didnt check in Packages. 

NuGet is not our binary. It is a third party tool. We need this tool to do msbuild. Without it, build wont work, I just tried.
@juwang I don't have NuGet.exe in other projects in VS and they can download packages just fine. Can we recreate that situation here?

The project names seem inconsistent. For instance, there is a `Evaluator`, but also a `REEFDriver`. Also, the names of projects don't match the file system. This would make it hard for new developers to pick this up. We can either fix these sorts of issues now or do them as JIRAs once the code is in...

-1

`mvn apache-rat:check` fails on this PR
Regarding NuGet.exe: Delete NuGet.exe and NuGet.Targets to make the build succeed.
Did you also delete Packages?
Yes, packages get fetched again.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #51](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/51/) FAILURE

removed NuGet.exe and set it as auto load.
fixed license header issues

[Reef-pull-request-ubuntu #218](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-ubuntu/218/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good

Apache RAT now passes. However, I have a couple of questions regarding the excludes added:

``` xml
<exclude>lang/cs/.nuget/**</exclude>
```

Files in this folder are version controlled and part of the release. Can't we just add licensing headers to them? Or otherwise, enumerate the files we can't have license headers on.

``` xml
<exclude>**/packages.config</exclude>
```

This is included in the above. Also, it could have a licensing header.

``` xml
<exclude>**/protobuf/**</exclude>
<exclude>**/avro/**</exclude>
```

We should move those to a separate folder for generated sources. Maybe not during this PR, but shortly after it.

``` xml
<exclude>**/*.conf</exclude>
<exclude>**/*.csv</exclude>
<exclude>**/*.bin</exclude>
```

These seem overly broad. For one. we usually shouldn't have `.bin` files. And in the other cases, we might have them and would want to add a license. It would be better to enumerate the exact files we want to have excluded.

Also, on a formatting subject: the indent level of the newly added exclusions doesn't match the others.
Please merge current master and make sure the bridge-project reference the parent `pom.xml` in the right places.
@bgchun Are all you comments addressed? If so, I think this can be merged.

Please add a commit message as defined in the contributor's guide :-)
All the license headers on the .csproj files disappeared. Where they removed by VS?
I accidentally left them out when I was working on them.  I'll add them back and update the .sln file to use VS 2013
I've addressed these comments in the latest commit.

[Reef-pull-request-windows #58](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/58/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
There are still two `.dll` files in this PR. Can they be removed?
I will have a separate PR to address C# code build from pom file and remove driver.dll.
Ok, what about the other dll?
mvn apache-rat:check does not pass.

Another dll is msvcr110.dll. It is not created by us. If we go to the solution not to pack it into jar file in the future, we might just get it from somewhere and drop it into a folder where we put all clr libraries.
Which file doesnt pass mvn apache-rat:check license header check? I run it in my env and all files passed.

regarding msvcr110.dll: it is the visual c++ libraries needed to run applications developed on visual c++ (in this case the managed c++ bridge code). the library will be available on any machine with visual c++ redistributed package installed. however, we have encountered cases where that is not true in the past, so it is added to be packed into reef jar to be safe.

i can see pros and cons for whether to keep it or to remove it. i can side with either, this is just full disclosure so that a proper decision can be made ;)
@beysims `mvn apache-rat:check` passes for me as well. Something could be off with your setup.
@yingdachen Thanks for the description! I don't think Microsoft grants us the right to redistribute it, though. Is it available as a NuGet such that we can just depend on the DLL that way?

@markusweimer This looks promising:

http://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.VCLibs.110.Redist.x86/1.0.0-alpha

[Reef-pull-request-windows #59](https://builds.apache.org/job/Reef-pull-request-windows/59/) FAILURE
Looks like there's a problem with this pull request
I'll merge this
@yingdachen Thanks! I filled [REEF-125](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-125) to track this. I think we can move forward with this PR then.

@beysims @jwang98052 Turns out this was a missing exclude entry for Apache RAT. We did not exclude `.iml` files anymore. This has been fixed in [REEF-124](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/REEF-124).
